014package de.softwareforge.testing.postgres.embedded;
015
016import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.assertEquals;
017import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.assertFalse;
018import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.assertTrue;
019
020import java.io.File;
021import java.sql.Connection;
022import java.sql.ResultSet;
023import java.sql.Statement;
024
025import org.junit.jupiter.api.Assumptions;
026import org.junit.jupiter.api.Test;
027
028public class LocalDirectoryPostgresTest {
029
030    private static final File USR_LOCAL = new File("/usr/local");
031    private static final File USR_LOCAL_BIN_POSTGRES = new File(USR_LOCAL, "/bin/postgres");
032
033    @Test
034    public void testEmbeddedPg() throws Exception {
035        Assumptions.assumeTrue(USR_LOCAL_BIN_POSTGRES.exists(), "Skipping test, PostgreSQL binary not found in /usr/local/bin");
036
037        try (EmbeddedPostgres pg = EmbeddedPostgres.builderWithDefaults().useLocalPostgresInstallation(USR_LOCAL).build();
038                Connection c = pg.createDefaultDataSource().getConnection();
039                Statement s = c.createStatement()) {
040            try (ResultSet rs = s.executeQuery("SELECT 1")) {
041                assertTrue(rs.next());
042                assertEquals(1, rs.getInt(1));
043                assertFalse(rs.next());
044            }
045        }
046    }
047}
